data.title: JavaScript
data.desc: A high-level, versatile programming language primarily used for web development.

data.title: TypeScript
data.desc: A typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript.

data.title: Node.js
data.desc: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine for building server-side applications.

data.title: Sass
data.desc: A preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into CSS.

data.title: CSS3
data.desc: The latest evolution of the Cascading Style Sheets language used for styling web pages.

data.title: HTML5
data.desc: The latest version of Hypertext Markup Language, the standard language for creating web pages.

data.title: Express.js
data.desc: A minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides robust features for web and mobile applications.

data.title: Vite
data.desc: A fast build tool and development server for modern web projects, featuring hot module replacement.

data.title: Vitest
data.desc: A fast and simple test runner for Vite projects.

data.title: React
data.desc: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, maintained by Facebook and a community of developers.

data.title: Angular
data.desc: A platform for building mobile and desktop web applications, developed and maintained by Google.

data.title: Vue
data.desc: A progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces, designed to be incrementally adoptable.

data.title: Next.js
data.desc: A React framework with hybrid static and server-side rendering, TypeScript support, smart bundling, route pre-fetching, and more.

data.title: Tailwind CSS
data.desc: Tailwind CSS is an open-source CSS framework.

data.title: Git
data.desc: A distributed version-control system for tracking changes in source code during software development.

data.title: GitLab
data.desc: A web-based DevOps lifecycle tool that provides a Git repository manager providing wiki, issue-tracking, and CI/CD pipeline features.

data.title: GitHub
data.desc: A platform for version control and collaboration, allowing multiple people to work on projects simultaneously.

data.title: Mocha
data.desc: A feature-rich JavaScript test framework running on Node.js, making asynchronous testing simple and fun.

data.title: Jest
data.desc: A delightful JavaScript testing framework with a focus on simplicity.

data.title: Gulp
data.desc: A toolkit for automating painful or time-consuming tasks in your development workflow.

data.title: Markdown
data.desc: A lightweight markup language with plain-text formatting syntax, designed to be easy to read and write.

data.title: MDX
data.desc: A format that lets you seamlessly write JSX in your Markdown documents.

data.title: Storybook
data.desc: An open source tool for developing UI components in isolation for React, Vue, and Angular.

data.title: StyleX
data.desc: StyleX is a simple, easy-to-use JavaScript syntax and compiler for styling web apps that was developed by Meta.

data.title: MySQL
data.desc: An open-source relational database management system based on Structured Query Language (SQL).

data.title: GraphQL
data.desc: A query language for your API, and a server-side runtime for executing queries by using a type system you define for your data.

data.title: Webpack
data.desc: A static module bundler for modern JavaScript applications.

data.title: Babel
data.desc: A JavaScript compiler that transforms ES6+ code into a backwards-compatible version of JavaScript in current and older browsers or environments.

data.title: Jenkins
data.desc: An open-source automation server that enables developers to reliably build, test, and deploy their software.

data.title: Docker
data.desc: A set of platform-as-a-service products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers.

data.title: Kubernetes
data.desc: An open-source container-orchestration system for automating application deployment, scaling, and management.

data.title: Figma
data.desc: A web-based UI design and prototyping tool.

data.title: jQuery
data.desc: A JavaScript framework that facilitates the readability and the manipulation of HTML DOM elements, event handling, animations, and AJAX calls.

data.title: Contentful
data.desc: Contentful is a Headless CMS that provides all the tools and capabilities to drive your content management and delivery.

data.title: Styled Components
data.desc: Styled-components is a popular library for React and React Native that allows you to use component-level styles in your application

data.title: Notion
data.desc: An all-in-one workspace for notes, tasks, databases, and collaboration.

data.title: Adobe XD
data.desc: Vector design tool for web and mobile applications, developed and published by Adobe Inc.

data.title: Jira
data.desc: A proprietary issue tracking product developed by Atlassian that allows bug tracking and agile project management.

data.title: Miro
data.desc: Digital collaboration platform designed to facilitate remote and distributed team communication and project management.

data.title: Firebase
data.desc: A platform developed by Google for creating mobile and web applications.

data.title: GSAP
data.desc: A JavaScript library for creating high-performance animations that work in all major browsers.

data.title: Framer
data.desc: A design tool for creating interactive prototypes and animations.

data.title: Visual Studio
data.desc: A source-code editor developed by Microsoft for Windows, Linux, and macOS.

data.title: Axios
data.desc: A promise-based HTTP client for the browser and Node.js.

data.title: Redux
data.desc: A predictable state container for JavaScript apps, often used with React.

data.title: XState
data.desc: A library for creating, interpreting, and executing finite state machines and statecharts in JavaScript.

data.title: Jotai
data.desc: A primitive and flexible state management library for React.

data.title: Gatsby
data.desc: A React-based open source framework for creating websites and apps.
